definition: lit. presenting the Buddha with borrowed flowers (idiom); fig. to win favor or influence using sb else's property/plagiarism
to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
to offer/to present/to dedicate/to donate/to show/to put on display/worthy person (old)

sentences.english: Be shy of favours bestowed at the expense of others.
sentences.chinese: 享用借花献佛的恩惠是要付出代价的。

sentences.english: We are publishing it as part of our tribute to Charles Darwin on his 200th birthday.
sentences.chinese: 借花献佛，以此向达尔文诞辰200周年献礼。

definition: (of a gift) to be a small token of one's feelings
gift given to sb when meeting them for the first time
to do sb a favor at little cost
toss a peach, get back a plum (idiom); to return a favor/to exchange gifts/Scratch my back, and I'll scratch yours.
Don't get a reward if it's not deserved. (idiom)
to offer an apology/to make amends
not to reciprocate is against etiquette (classical)/to respond in kind
pinyin: lai2 er2 bu4 wang3 fei1 li3 ye3

definition: deference is no substitute for obedience (idiom)/(said to accept sb's request, invitation etc)
pinyin: gong1 jing4 bu4 ru2 cong2 ming4
